name: HIPAA Software Compliance Template
description: This template is designed to help guide the development of HIPAA-compliant software systems. It includes sections aligned with HIPAA principles such as privacy, security, risk management, and auditing.

sections.name: Access Control
sections.description: Ensure only authorized individuals can access ePHI.

rules.name: Unique User Identification
rules.rule: Each user accessing the system must be assigned a unique user ID.

rules.name: Automatic Logoff
rules.rule: Implement automatic session timeouts after a defined period of inactivity.

rules.name: Encryption and Decryption
rules.rule: Implement encryption and decryption mechanisms for ePHI transmission and storage.

sections.name: Audit Controls
sections.description: Implement hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in information systems that contain or use ePHI.

rules.name: Audit Log Generation
rules.rule: Generate audit logs for all access to ePHI including user identification, date/time, and type of action performed.

rules.name: Audit Log Protection
rules.rule: Protect audit logs from unauthorized access, modification, or deletion.

rules.name: Audit Log Review
rules.rule: Implement procedures for regular review and analysis of audit logs.

sections.name: Integrity
sections.description: ePHI must not be improperly altered or destroyed.

rules.name: Data Integrity Controls
rules.rule: Implement controls to ensure ePHI is not improperly altered or destroyed.

rules.name: Electronic Signature
rules.rule: Implement electronic signature mechanisms to verify data integrity.

sections.name: Person or Entity Authentication
sections.description: Verify that a person or entity seeking access to ePHI is the one claimed.

rules.name: User Authentication
rules.rule: Implement strong authentication mechanisms to verify user identity before granting access to ePHI.

rules.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
rules.rule: Implement multi-factor authentication for accessing systems containing ePHI.

sections.name: Transmission Security
sections.description: Guard against unauthorized access to ePHI that is being transmitted over an electronic communications network.

rules.name: End-to-End Encryption
rules.rule: Implement end-to-end encryption for all ePHI transmissions over networks.

rules.name: Network Controls
rules.rule: Implement network controls to prevent unauthorized access during ePHI transmission.
